【考法 1】 vi. 密谋：to cooperate secretly or have a secret understanding; collude
【例】They connived to take over the throne.
【近】conspire, intrigue, plot, collude, machinate ,put up
【考法 2】 v. 纵容：假装忽视或并未采取措施阻止错误： to pretend ignorance of or fail to take action against something one ought to oppose
【例】 The guards were suspected of conniving at the prisoner's escape.
【近】 blink, disregard, overlook, wink
【反】 disapprove 反对
【派】 conniver n. 共谋者
【记】 con + knives 一起动刀→共谋坏事
